Reviews.Title: Can't beat it for the money.
Reviews.Author: Madge
Reviews.Content: Got the system before delivery date and was happy with that.  Set everything up and had no trouble with it whatsoever.  Had to set two of the camera's about one hundred and fifty feet away from the house, therefore, had to order extra cable.  Did not loose any signal. Everything looks and works good.  I am very satisfied with the system.

Reviews.Title: met my needs and expectations
Reviews.Author: David Byler
Reviews.Content: Camera system set up fine and worked right away. Networking it was a tad tricky, but I found the Zmodo online tutorial to be very helpful. Got it all working fine, and now can watch all cameras from my phone or any computer. Definitely bang for the buck on this system.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: Mr Twigbert
Reviews.Content: This system is good for the money.. It's not great but for the money I spent but I would suggest this system to my friends and family..First, I purchased the system with only 4 cameras.. I then forgot to order a few 150' cables but that was my fault.. Once the system was installed I found 4 cameras is good for a general over view of my home but I decided I wanted 4 more to really place them in the perfect spots (like sidewalks) to really catch a persons face..My first system had problems.. I called the tech support and they were super helpful.. They decided my system was bad.. They cross shipped me a new DVR so I'd have to rate Zmodo's customer service as an "A".. I'd give it an "A+" but it sounded like they had 50 support people in a small room and there was alot of echo when trying to talk to the tech..The second DVR works great.. Easy to use..The cameras are good at best.. As mentioned above, the first 4 cameras are good for an over view of your property but if something happened there is NO WAY you'd be able to ID the person from more than 10 ft away as the cameras are fuzzy.. You'd be able to see their clothing but that's about it.. I then used my other 4 cameras to place on sidewalks where someone would have to walk to get into my home and those cameras help ALOT.. Their still not great but again, it was a $300 system.. I looked at digital systems and they are like $2,000.. This system isn't great but if I moved I buy the same exact one again.. But with 8 cameras and the extra long cords..With 8 cameras the system will record for about 8 days before over writing the old video.. I wished I got a bigger hard drive but that can always be upgraded later..

Reviews.Title: Great Company/Great Product
Reviews.Author: HeyMrL
Reviews.Content: The company was very accomodating.  They were out of stock on my original item, they gave me 2 choices to upgrade at no cost.  They communicated with me very quickly and were a pleasure to deal with.  The  system plugged right in.  I have upgrade 2 of the cameras to higher resolution for better night vision.  For an entry level system it is great.

Reviews.Title: UPDATED: Complete waste of money. Utterly useless.
Reviews.Author: King Dingbat "KingDingbat"
Reviews.Content: ===UPDATED===DO NOT expect this system to help you identify any criminal or person, or even a vehicle. After about a week of use, which now includes trying to playback video, I have decided to update my review and knock it down to one star. I can't understand why anyone would like this set. To say I'm extremely disappointed is an understatement. If the system didn't take me so long to install, I would send it back immediately. Who wants to deal spending more time to take everything down now? Tech support is non existent (See below) and online help is a joke. I have yet to be able to view these cameras over the internet or my smartphone and cannot get help to troubleshoot.--Image Quality--One of my main complaints is that the cameras are terrible at dealing with light and exposure levels. I wish there was a night vision intensity setting, or exposure settings, which would make them so much better. We live in Southern California where it's always sunny. Don't expect to be able to see anything if your camera is pointed at a surface the sun touches. Just the reflected light will wash out your video nearly completely, and forget trying to view any direction which is even slightly towards the sun itself. We get the best quality image (from light conditions) right now about 8:30am to 11am. (Basically, when it's overcast, before the sun burns off the night clouds.)Then there's the IR lights at night. First, if you have any sort of standard lights (Porch lights, motion lights, garden lights, etc.), the cameras are oblivious to them and do not adjust their images to include that light. The infared light is always on, and by itself easily ruins any image from the camera if you're not careful (Don't point the IR light cameras at any surface closer than 20 feet away, or BAM wash out!). Together the IR light with your regular home lighting completely ruins the picture.Speaking of the picture, the advertising says "provide crystal clear video image at day and night" which is a blatant lie. I did not expect these cameras to be HD at all, but the images these cameras produce at the highest quality settings, in the best light of the day are horrendous. and I can't imagine them being able to positively identify any would-be thief. I couldn't even recognize the vehicle of one of my regular contractors, and it has enormous graphics emblazoned on it. Additionally, the video is grainy and has wavy lines throughout each picture. I have read that the video quality degrades the longer the cables are that you use, but I cannot imagine many outdoor home installations that can use the only 60 ft cable they provide for each camera. Some cameras could be within 60 ft of the DVR unit, but if you install them properly (going around corners, hidden under eves, etc.) you're going to have to buy extensions for at least some cameras.Colors are pretty washed out, but color is generally unimportant to me, except I'm jealous of the nice color I see from other people online. There are color settings in the settings, but they are generally useless.--Playback--After recording for a week or so, I decided I wanted to investigate who was letting their dog poop in my front yard. The software is cumbersome, and I was shocked to learn that the "video" is more like a *slideshow* as the DVR only records about 1 or 2 frames per second, despite my having it set to "Full" which is supposed to be 30 FPS. I can improve the frame rate, if I lower the resolution of the recording, but honestly, how useful is that when the resolution is so bad in the first place? Speaking of resolution, I was shocked at how small the video files are when played back on a computer, after export. If I choose the highest resolution "D1" setting which sacrifices frame right, the video file at 100% size in my computer's media player is about 3 inches wide. If I switch to the "CIF" resolution, which sacrifices resolution for frame rate, its about 2 inches wide. WHO THE HELL CAN SEE A FACE CLEARLY AT 2 or 3 INCHES?! When you enlarge the video it makes the video completely unusable because it is so grainy. NOTE that these are at "BEST" and "Full" quality settings in the DVR settings.The maximum FF speed is 16x, which I was unhappy about at first, because when going through hours of video, it still takes lots of time to find any activity. However, I realized that any faster and you probably wouldn't see anybody any of the action in the preview. I think a "Skip to movement" button would probably help, but overall, it's not too hard to find what you're looking for, especially if you have any sort of idea when the activity happened.Clipping snippets out of playback and exporting to a USB drive was very easy. Probably the easiest thing about this system.--Installation--Installation was quite a chore, taking me several days and lots of frustration. I would return this product in immediately if it didn't take me a whole week to install. Also, You cannot invert an image in the system settings, so I when I needed to install the cameras upside down (which is almost every camera) I had to take them apart and rig them in ways that were not intended to make the cameras hang right-side-up. Unfortunately, I learned this the hard way, because I assumed any decent camera system would allow me to invert or rotate image signals.It is important to note, that the documentation is terrible and does not include trouble shooting, and online help is virtually useless as it only duplicates the paper documents. I still have yet to get the system to work over the internet or on my smartphone, and when I tried to chat with tech support, they put me on hold for 15 minutes and then the department "was unavailable" and it told me to leave a message. The message went unanswered.I wouldn't buy this set again. It's nearly useless.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Jacob Duran
Reviews.Content: really gave this product a 5 based on the tech support line, easy set up and literally anyone can do it. hardest part is finding where to mount the cameras, then call tech line and they will set up remote viewing for you!

Reviews.Title: Great buy for the Price!
Reviews.Author: John Chase
Reviews.Content: This camera system is an amazing buy. For the price the quality is unbeatable. It has been easy to use and easier to install. I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Great beginner security camera system.
Reviews.Author: Grego
Reviews.Content: Excellent for my first camera security system. The only thing I dislike about the cameras is the swivel part where you tighten a screw to hold the camera still. I've had a couple that stripped with barely any pressure and now can't use. Other than that everything is great even customer service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great entry level system
Reviews.Author: EvilNCarnate
Reviews.Content: This system works better than expected really. My wife was even impressed with the video quality for the price. I finally got around to setting this up today. I have it hooked to one of my TV's for regular viewing, then also have the management software installed on a laptop, the app installed on my phone, the ports forwarded and changed and a dynamicdns set up with zmodo so I can access it anywhere anytime. I literally configured all of this and physically installed and wired 4 cameras today while doing other chores. All wires hidden away and tucked out of site before going through my mud sills, in the basement, up through the floor and into the wall.Video quality of the cameras during the day is great, at night is pretty good too. Best case I can ID a person when they do something malicious, worst case it just scares a few off.

Reviews.Title: camera works great
Reviews.Author: Kathy Revette
Reviews.Content: i purchased another dvr and had so many problems. this one works like it says it will. i have to admit the setting up took some help with a tech (minor) but they were very helpful so its been working good. not sure about setting up the remote but i'm hopeful they will help out if i need it again. worth the money to watch over your property

Reviews.Title: Works quite well - love it
Reviews.Author: DB
Reviews.Content: I have had this for about 3 weeks now, have 5 of the 8 cameras installed. I do have lighting (motion lights) near the cameras so the night vision is quite good with lighting.  It took me the better part of a day to get the LAN and remote viewing (iphone) working but there are a lot of videos and help guides online.The DVR works well although as some have posted the remote is lacking but with the mouse it is easy to search and play recorded video. Controlling from my laptop is a snap as well.  You will need to format the DVR hard drive before using it which takes about 2 minutes and is a menu option.I will upgrade a couple of the cameras some day just to get more control and PTZ options.Great system for the money.

Reviews.Title: It will do the job
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints with the performance of the hardware at all. The initial setup was fairly quick, and within minutes of mocking up the system, I was seeing what I expected. The devil is in the details. The owners manual is completely full of grammatical and spelling errors. Trying to interpret poor English into something usable is a fruitless task. Unfortunately, I began the install on a Saturday which meant no tech support. Again, the basic setup and installation is easy, it's the higher level functionality that makes this system difficult.

Reviews.Title: I only have step 1 of 3 done
Reviews.Author: Scott "Scott M. Wright"
Reviews.Content: Hooking up the cameras are a snap.  Instructions could be a little better.  Took about 20 minutes to find out what the password to the remote control was.  I still have to figure out how to hook it up to the internet.  I just need a clone I am so busy.

Reviews.Title: Not so Great. Spend More and Get Better Quality
Reviews.Author: Mo-z
Reviews.Content: This was purchased for use as a home security system and I believe the unit I recieved was defective as the cameras would only see a person at night in ir mode if they were to stick their nose to the cameras.the daytime picture seem good anough but if they don't work at night whats the use of a security system.Amazon issued a ups pick up label and gave me a refund for the purchase making the whole thing rather painless. Thank You Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Extremely low quality
Reviews.Author: Andrew Blaine
Reviews.Content: All images are extremely fuzzy, very poor quality. The setup was rather easy, but connecting to the device is too restricted for Internet Explorer and the iphone app isn't intuitive. Returned them after having them on for about 30 minutes. Maybe I am more disappointed because I currently use a Foscam camera connected to my Synology Nas surveillance system and the quality is remarkably better.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE DVR & CUSTOMER SERVICE
Reviews.Author: pop
Reviews.Content: I bought the Zmodo system and it DIDN'T last 30 days. I had to call customer service 3 times within 3 1/2 weeks. each call took over 70 minutes. The final time the customer rep ACTUALLY had me take the DVR apart to have my try to fix it by disassembling it myself. That didn't work so he told me as soon as they receive it they will fix it and ship it back out within 24 hours. But When they received it, I got a email stating they will get to it in the order it was received. I strongly suggest if you want a reliable product that will last longer than 30 days, buy a different product. If you want customer service that knows what they are doing and tell you one policy NOT two different policies, buy a different product.  Im goin on 6 days without being able to use the product I paid for no more than 1 month ago

Reviews.Title: Great for the Money
Reviews.Author: R. Perry
Reviews.Content: This DVR is great for the money. The cameras really aren't all that great but they definitely give you an idea of what's going on. Don't expect to read tags, or have clear facial pictures, but if you are monitoring these remotely, you'll have a heads up on what is happening, and can call the proper authorities. Also you can retrieve video remotely, an added bonus! Would buy again if I had a need for a second set.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money.
Reviews.Author: Carlos Dillard
Reviews.Content: After talking with several neighbors who have security camera systems I decided to take the plunge and after much research I decided Zmodo had the most bang for the buck. I agree with with a fellow reviewer that the manual sucks, the brackets are cheap and I too am going to have to contact Zmodo to view the cameras on my smart phone and tablets.However, installation is a breeze. I purchased extra wiring just in case the ones supplied were long enough, but I actually more than enough to run a camera the full length of my 1800 sq ft home.The manual and the difficulty of setting this system up for remotely viewing on phones and away from home is the only thing keeping this from being a 5 star system.

Reviews.Title: Worthless
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: If anyone is looking for an easy to use, reliable security system, this is NOT for you.  The software is junk and doesnt appear to be updated since 1980.  Absolutely no customer support.  Cameras are cheap and very pixelated at even short distances.  Night vision is no good after about 10 feet, if you have your camera 15 feet off the ground and you have someone 10 feet away you can't tell if it is a bear or a person.After installing all cameras and running all cables through attic and roof, 3 cameras don't work all the time, they go on and offline.  I took care when running cable not to pull or tug too much, but now I have 3 cameras that "sometimes" work.I had to purchase an external hdmi converter box to be able to hook up to TV since the only outbound connector is a VGA cable.My word of advice is don't buy.

Reviews.Title: Gms
Reviews.Author: Gms
Reviews.Content: Excellent product easy to install.the price is great. Customer support is excellent just make sure to call them mon-fri for tech support

Reviews.Title: Awesome so far
Reviews.Author: EDWARD E HARMON
Reviews.Content: Awesome product and easy to setup.  I had no problems with the camera set up would recommend AGPtek® Brand New 2.5" Color TFT LCD Monitor Handheld Surveillance CCTV install tool.  Helps when you are up on a ladder.  Awesome night vision and can not beat the networking options.

Reviews.Title: THIS COMPANY IS HORRIBLE
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Seffron
Reviews.Content: we have to call tech support at Zmodo because it isn't working so we do. then the hard drive crashes and they still can't tell us why they tell us to contact the seller so we do and they are horrible you never talk to the same person and each person tells you something different and you spend 5 months back and forth and then 5 months later they say well sorry you are just stuck with a POS and tuff we just stole your money and refuse to do anything about it. I am contacting the BBB in IL and the state attorneys office in IL as well this company will run you in circles and give you the run around for months just so they can tell you tuff.UPDATE ----- Zmodo worked with me and did get me new camera's they even gave me a upgrade due to the problems with this seller. I just got the new camera's in the mail today I will post a report as soon as I get them hooked up this weekend. The manufacturer Zmodo worked with me not the seller so that is why I am keeping the rating.

Reviews.Title: Just OK
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: The price was right on this and all the reviews I read while shopping were incredibly helpful.  I still have a few cameras to set up but so far they have not been too complicated.  It's not super user friendly on playback or programming but it's not too difficult either.  I haven't hooked it up to my network yet so that may change my mind but as of right now, it's OK.  The quality of the picture isn't earth-shattering but it's not too bad.  The night vision struggles if there is ambient light in the area but with strategic placement of the cameras, it'll do the job just fine and for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: Nice for the  Money!
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: It took some time to hook it all up and run the wires but I like trying new things. Everything seems to be holding up so far and the camera quality is pretty good for what your paying. I feel safer having it around and it is nice to check on things from my laptop. I have to admit per other reviews it was tough to get a hold of tech support with questions at first but when they called back they were very nice, very patient and very knowledgeable about their product. I had some trouble figuring the network set-ups so I had tech support take over my machine and it was done it about 15-20 mins tops. I would recommend calling and leaving a message or emailing to have then call you to set-up a time to talk or take over your machine. Very happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Quality product for the price
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: I had been looking at camera systems for awhile and when my 100ft. extension cord went missing I finally pulled the trigger and bought this system.The set up is straight forward but you'd better have a bit of computer knowledge for the networking part.Zmodo has a good tutorial but if you're computer illiterate you'll want someone to help you with it.Overall I love this system.I wish the cameras had a bit more clarity but for the price you just can't beat it.My place is under 24/7 surveillance now and the 500gb hard drive that comes with this system was one of the things that sold me as a lot of higher end systems don't include a hard drive.Caught a would be criminal yesterday before he had a chance to break into my neighbors truck.I happened to be sitting in front of my monitor yesterday while I watched him case out the truck.Called my neighbor and we nipped it in the bud.Maybe now we will once and for all rid the neighborhood of these metal scrapping criminal thugs.

Reviews.Title: Waaaaaay too complicated
Reviews.Author: Mac
Reviews.Content: I had a tech with a master's degree in computer engineering do my install on this product.  It was NOT terribly intuitive to set up on the harddrive once the cameras were up and the cables were run. User interface reminds me a bit of DOS. After tweaking the camera placement/direction and masking the motion sensors on each camera, we found that the system was NOT Mac-compatible on any Mac browser, and was ONLY PC compatible on versions of IE 6 and earlier. Would not work via cell browser on an iPhone either. So the #1 reason re: remote monitoring that I bought the system for was essentially useless, but at this point, the system was up, semi-running, so there was no returning it. The system does a good job of recording and the cameras are pretty much plug & play, but the user interface to go back and review recordings is very clunky. I also downloaded the ZViewer from the App Store to use on my iPhone ... the tutorial is clearly written from a Chinese translation, and "assumes" the user knows all the settings like IP address and port #s.  Very confusing and supremely frustrating.  Customer support on the website that they claim is live chat 365/24/7 doesn't work on Sunday afternoons, so customers are urged just to send an email rather than solve the problem then and there.  This was not only an expensive enterprise, but it doesn't do what I really need, and that compromises my family's safety. Not happy. At all.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price
Reviews.Author: MC
Reviews.Content: Had I known how excellent this camera system is, I would have replaced my old cameras sooner.Great vision, especially the night vision. What also makes this system great is that it doesn't need acomputer to work, just a hard drive for recording!

Reviews.Title: Poor video images from cameras
Reviews.Author: JMC
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this kit with CMOS cameras.  The video is poor day or night and worthless.  Buy a Zmodo kit with CCD cameras and make sure the kit includes an installed hard drive.

Reviews.Title: tech support
Reviews.Author: FauxOscar
Reviews.Content: The unit is pretty easy to set up,seems to be working well.The tech support is great, IF you can contact someone! the two people they have are not available "24/7" as the website suggests, they will eventually call you back,sometimes days later while you are driving, or nowhere near the device that needs attention.If the thing lasts I will buy more of them.

Reviews.Title: Works very well at best price around
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Paradis
Reviews.Content: This item works as described and works with only moderate effort to install. This is by far the best price around and is much cheaper than building your system, Zmodo app works well but some of the third party apps work even better. Some HA systems even can incorporate some IP cameras directly, but I haven't attempted to do so yet. Image quality is pretty good, especially for closer images, long distance viewing for general watching is also very good but level of detail is much lower. Can upgrade to different cameras (larger sensor, PTZ, etc). Which is a plus. Also, 500gb hard drive is quite large for most applications.

Reviews.Title: great and easy
Reviews.Author: willgosomewhereelsenow
Reviews.Content: great price easy set up .. easy to use with lots of options got on cctv what we were trying 2 get in less than 2 weeks lolupdate!!! going great!!!! recording over 1 month dvr not full lol great product, great picture great!!!

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Ak-47full
Reviews.Content: Wow, only took 2 days for the product to arrive. I'm from Puerto Rico and I didn't expected such a fast delivery. The product looks new, box was in good shape, I did try all 8 cameras and the Dvr and they work fine. I Will recommend this product to my family and friends. So far it's working. I will update later how's this camera system is working.

Reviews.Title: Ok for price
Reviews.Author: Gary G
Reviews.Content: The one thing I will say about this product is. Be ready to do some information searching. The manual that comes with this product is terrible.

Reviews.Title: A must!
Reviews.Author: Jibber Yoda
Reviews.Content: I don't know how we lived without cameras in the past around the house. I had some backyard stuff stolen and a garage break-in where a 150cc scooter and an expensive ladder was also stolen. It infuriated me that I could not see who they were, how many etc... cops do nothing in these cases, but the insurance company paid me for the scooter which was great. so that was then. With 8 cameras it is just enough to hit every angle of our 2 family house and backyard. We have ours in the kitchen connected to a 19 inch monitor, for us it's the center of the house were there's always someone doing something, or you have to pass by it. I also set the DVR on the local network so all the computers or wireless laptops in the house can see all the cameras too anytime with a click. The software is decent, we just leave it always running on every computer in the background and either minimize it or maximize it to see what's going on around the house. It's nice to look out, see what the kids are doing, check what the dog is doing, if the cat wants to come into the house, who it's barking at, who's at the front or back door ringing that bell, see if the deliveryman already dropped off that package, if there's mail in the mailboxes, who's parked and where around the house. This Zmodo system is sufficient for a typical family, for me it is easy to operate, quality is OKAY, i have manually set the main recording bit rate to 2048Kbps and 512Kbps for the substream (the substream decides the quality and speed of the cameras viewed through the network) which is the highest you can go, however with the 500GB hard drive it can only store data for about 4 days and 4 nights at this quality, then it starts overwriting data of course. I will likely upgrade to a 2GB drive once this one dies given they aren't very expensive. The white cameras blend easily on our white house and garage. A few of the cables weren't long enough so I used 2-pair cat3 phone wire to splice and extend them, there's only 3 very thin wires inside these camera cables, so splice carefully and use solder to make good connections. No loss in quality whatsoever even on quite long runs. Took about two days to run wire and probably another hiding the wire, tucking everything in and patching up and caulking holes etc. It is also a good idea to untwist every camera's lens cover and apply a small amount of weatherproofing lubricant, such as lithium grease to the treads, that way you wont just rely on the small rubber gaskets inside these and they can easily unscrew later for cleaning and wont seize up. Once I was satisfied with all the camera positions I also put a little marine goop glue to the camera holder arms so they won't move in strong winds as those mounts can be a bit flimsy otherwise. Overall, satisfied, we've had these now for about 6 months installed and I would never live again without the convenience of cameras around my house

Reviews.Title: very nice, decent resolution ok night vision
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: I too was upgraded from 480tvl to 600tvl without extra charge a pleasant surprise, I will say that installation of this product is labor intensive Ive spent most of my Saturday installing 6 of the 8 cameras, I would give this item 5 stars however 2 of the cables delivered were busted and I routed them through my entire house before finding this out (I was not enthralled) I will be contacting the seller to ask that those cables be replaced other than that time will tell, I haven't attempted to configure the DVR portion or the Internet access as of yet, I will be back with an update should anything unexpected occur.

Reviews.Title: Problems with Android Phones
Reviews.Author: Caballo "Jorge"
Reviews.Content: I did install this cameras and the system. It’s true that you have to be extra careful with the wires. They break easy. Had a very hard time making the DVR connection to my cellphone. I called the Customer Service and they were excellent. The picture it’s clear and the install was easy. The network setting it’s not easy. Very difficult to install the network part, but Zmodo has a step by step do it yourself website but I see again it’s not easy for an average person to get this to work. Zmodo had to access my computer remotely after waiting around 3 to 4 hours. Once you get a hold of customer support and have all your ducks in a row, they do a good job. I still can make my android phone work with the system but all my Apple products work like a charm.

Reviews.Title: real nice pics  great easy program
Reviews.Author: John Pazderski Jr.
Reviews.Content: besides hiding wires the pic on this thing is awesome dvr works great  i am not a huge fan of running wires but cant go wrong

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Zak
Reviews.Content: Very nice I like it it is working very good and clear I recommended to other and easy to install.

Reviews.Title: ZMODO 500GB 8 camera security system.
Reviews.Author: Darth Vader
Reviews.Content: Excellent buy. camera was upgraded to 600tvl. I wasn't notified this company just did it..!! This company (zmodo), is all about customer satisfaction. This surveillance package was a steal. clear vision, nite optics are fine. you get more bang for your buck. exteremly satisfied i went with zmodo. I will buy from them again.fast shipping

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: gc
Reviews.Content: works great. very easy to install.tech support is the best.dvr is easy to work and can cameras have good viewing.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: Cory Lutz
Reviews.Content: This item is good.  We use it as part of our paranormal investigations and it has decent night vision and is super clear during daylight hours if used then.  It comes well packaged and is wicked easy to use, set up, and review.  Good product for us at www.pastpresentparanormal.com

Reviews.Title: great bye
Reviews.Author: michael campbell
Reviews.Content: very good system that met my needs. was very easy to install. I will recommend this to other people  where I leve.

Reviews.Title: Installed Myself
Reviews.Author: laura deters
Reviews.Content: I installed this sytem myself which saved alot of time and money. It works very good I have not been able to look at it remotely or get it to work on my phone but it does an excellent job and blows up very well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Home System! Ignore the bad reviews! Well worth the money!
Reviews.Author: djrocc
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I am extremely impressed with this system! I have been an electrician/low voltage tech for over 25 years and this has to be the cheapest-easiest-most versatile home surveillance system i have come across! 8 ir cameras and a dvr with remote viewing anywhere for $250... Cant beat that no way no how! Zmodo techs are also very helpful when setting up the internet access thru your router. I also routed the signal thru my home entertainment system and can view this dvr on any tv/pc in my home. Great job Zmodo!

Reviews.Title: only one week installed but GOOD camera system
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I installed all the cables in the attic and dvr setup was very simple but I am an electronics nerd so I didn't think it would be too hard.  I used 6 of the 8 cams all around my house and out of the 8 cameras 1 was unusable! (blurred to death)  no big deal.... they are $12 cams give or take.  So I got to the networking portion of this and it took 10 min.  I was a little afraid based off of the reviews from tech savy people but it was not very hard.  I downloaded the Zviewer app for iphone and I added my devices and I am now watching my house from work on 3g.  As far as the cam quality..... Its not as bad as I thought it was going to be.  You won't be able to make out a plate or an exact face but you can SEE.  Night vision is not great unless you have some ambient light somewhere but I have plenty of that around my house so it works for me.  The motion recording is a bit weird but it works also and has a delay to capture that moment even after the motion object has stopped.  The dvr interface is very basic and could really use an upgrade and better looks.  It took me about 4hrs to get everything done and I was able to use the supplied 60ft cables everywhere which was nice.

Reviews.Title: Excellent system
Reviews.Author: No7JackDaniels
Reviews.Content: Easy setup, great camera features, love the shading feature to blur out area's of recording.  Unfortunately the remote never worked and the internet configuration never worked, plus I wanted to have more camera's.  The customer service was excellent, understanding and helpful on returning the unit.  Bought a 16 camera system through the same company, everything works perfectly!

Reviews.Title: Apartment Security
Reviews.Author: Cheris Johnson
Reviews.Content: We are using this for our apartment complex.  It is great.  We can see faces of people coming and going even in the dark.

Reviews.Title: Zmodo KDB8 Review - Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Shua Jables
Reviews.Content: First, I should say that I got this system almost purely for peace of mind (very handy when you can just buy that). I didn't buy this intending to ID intruders or read license plates. I only came in with the expectation of being able to see human beings, an opposum, and a racoon, that's all.Video quality: For my purposes (see above) it is as good as I expected it to be and does its job well.Camera installation: I'll admit, I'm a bit embarrased to say this but perhaps someone else may not realize this either. I couldn't figure out how to mount this to my roof overhangs outside. None of the cameras came with any instructions. It finally dawned on me that if you take the weather shield off the top, you can screw the mounting base into that now available hole (I know, but in my defense I hadn't slept good in about a week). So, there you go.Network setup: First, I see a lot of people complaining that the network was hard to setup. If you don't know what you're doing, it will be hard to set up. I had no idea how to do all the port forwarding, IP checking, DVR setup, mobile phone setup, etc. So yes, it took me a couple of hours as a networking novice. Now that I've done it and understand how all this networking business works, I could get it setup again in about 1/10th the time.Remote viewing from a PC: Internet Explorer setup was pretty straightforward. Just change the ActiveX controls, remember to check the box on the logon page and you're in.Remote viewing from an Android phone: I used IP Cam Viewer and setup was again pretty straightforward after I came to understand the network lingo.Overall, this system does exactly what I intended it to do and what I bought it for and setup was not a big deal (and as a bonus, I got to learn a lot about networking). Having this system now, it makes me want to upgrade to a 16-channel DVR and add cameras piecewise to my current 8 cameras.Gripe: The IR night view is a little weaker than I hoped. I will probably augment my system by building a couple of 890nm or 940nm IR LED strips to illuminate my exterior walls a bit better. I haven't decided exactly how I'm going to build these light bars yet, or if there is a product already out there that I can hack together to make an IR LED light bar. I'm not really interested in the IR floodlights since I don't have any cams that need to sense a very broad angle. Just a 10ft strip of IR LEDs that all face down. My thought right now is to buy 100 or so SMT LEDs and mount them on a flameproof 10ft piece of plastic connected together by thin tinned copper wire in parallel. I would probably build a custom 1.5V power supply (to be able to omit that voltage divider resistors) with a linear regulator or two in an IP67 enclosure with a built-in photosensor trigger. But if anyone has any other ideas I'd be grateful to hear them.

Reviews.Title: Very good system for the money
Reviews.Author: DJCramer
Reviews.Content: Works well. Pleased with the overall simplicity of the interface. Camera picture quality is good, not great, but that is to be expected with analog cameras at this price point. If you want the ability to zoom into someone's face from 65 feet away, you may want to consider an HD camera system.I found it easy to setup, however setting up network settings/SMTP alerts require some basic IT proficiency, however instructions were fairly clear if you followed them. All in all impressed with the value in this system and it does just what I need, provides surveillance of my home with remote monitoring.

Reviews.Content: Instruction manual is extremely lacking, hard to understand and set up, Need a PHD to operate,  It is easy to install but programing is definitely lacking.

Reviews.Title: Zmodo camera and dvr set up
Reviews.Author: David Snyder
Reviews.Content: As far as hooking every thing up, it was a breeze. Then there was trying to view it on a computer and smart phone, This was a really big deal. Had to call zmodo hot line like four times. Then be ready to wait quite a spell. They were very helpful, but my advice is to stay on the line with them while they tell you to do things because by the time you get that problem figured out, you jump right in to another. After figuring out all the technical issues I got it up and running. If your computer skills are weak, hire someone you will be glad you did. For the money the quality is pretty good, and play back viewing is pretty simple. Still have three other cameras to set up out side, but do not see any more problems.

Reviews.Title: The Zmodo KDB8-BARBZ8ZN-500GB 8-Channel H.264 DVR with 500GB HDD and 8 CMOS
Reviews.Author: Darlene Shortt
Reviews.Content: The security cameras are everything I expected and more.  I have the ability to see both day and night. I especially like the infrared and wide angle.

Reviews.Title: Good basic unit..

The cameras do work pretty well - there is a video on Youtube where a guy compares 4 different cameras and he is spot on with his evaluation. The DVR works pretty well, but considering I've never used anything else, I have nothing to compare it to. Good starter unit.

Reviews.Title: Awesome security camera system for the price!
Reviews.Author: Ashlee M Lopez
Reviews.Content: My husband said, & I QUOTE "I f***ing love my camera system."  I ordered the cameras without him knowing, and he was a bit skeptical about them after he found out....But him and a couple of other buddies of his set it up anyway and we are very pleased...It took me a while to set-up the remote network viewing, I tried doing it alone and failed, called tech support once and still wasn't able to get it, but then I called again and this tech was able to get it running! All I had to do was go to zmodo's simple help, called the toll-free number & the tech was able to remotely access my laptop, configured everything, and I was able to view the cameras from my iphone in no time!  If at first it doesn't work, don't hesitate to call again..you may find a technician that will be able to get it this time around incase the previous tech forgets something.

Reviews.Title: Zmodo KDB8 Security system
Reviews.Author: Lola M. Villalobos "Lola"
Reviews.Content: Love it.  Husband loves it. This one had the best reviews. That is why we decided 2 buy it. Basically easy 2 install. Haven't hooked it up 2 internet yet. That looks pretty complicated, & do not need 2 right now. The pix r so clear & vivid. Colors r bright on.  Easy 2 operate. I would highly recommend this system 2 everyone. U cannot beat the price for an 8 camera set-up. My neighbor bought another brand, paid the same, but only had 4 cameras, & the pix were not as nice as the Zmodo system.

Reviews.Content: Product came on time,  great for the price, the only reason I didn't give 5 stars is the manual suks.  The letters are extremely small and blury,  I had to called zmodo to view the cameras on the smart phone.Also the brackets are cheap.  Besides that I'm happy with the product.

Reviews.Title: Biggest piece of chinese crap ive seen in awhile
Reviews.Author: S. warner
Reviews.Content: Software locks up, not compatible with Windows 8. Setting the compatibility to Windows XP per their knowledge base works, sort of, but then adding the device to the software just shows it as "device offline" no matter WHAT you do. Iphone app throws errors ranging from "Fail to connect" to "InvalidChannelResponse". I am a system engineer and work on complex computer systems for a living, and couldn't get this thing up and running after 2 hours of screwing around with it.Could not get it working on the following:Internet Explorer (Windows won't let you install the CAB because it cannot identify the publisher or something) After bypassing the content protection and installing the CAB, the login button does NOTHING.NVMS windows software (Shows device as offline no matter what, even though ping/telnet to ports verify the unit it connected to the network)Windows Mobile (Doesn't recognize the CAB file.)DO NOT BUY THIS PIECE OF CHINESE CRAP!!!!! BEWARESENDING THIS BACK ASAP

Reviews.Title: Amazing value for the price!
Reviews.Author: Lagenorhincus
Reviews.Content: It took me 5mn to set it up and see the quality of these cameras.Pretty impressive I must say! I was not expecting such a clear picture, especially at night.. crystal clear!Another surprise was the 1TB HDD instead of the 500GB advertised...more recording I guess!Beside the drive came pre-formatted what saved me few minutes :o)The only drawback is the lack of audio, but the VCR can handle it, so I also bought some microphoneshere http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004REA7MG/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_33  along with somespecial audio cables extension, here http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004HY96DW/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_2and to  not have to run up and down to adjust your cameras, I suggest you get an handled monitor like this onehttp://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0085SZDYW/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_22I do not thing you could get any better that this surveillance kit anywhere!

Reviews.Title: Great 8 camera System
Reviews.Author: Jimmie S.
Reviews.Content: The camera security system arrived 2 days earlier than the expected delivery date and with in literally minutes I was viewing the cameras on my monitor. System is so easy to hook up that I never opened the instruction book. Very easy to figure out and find the menus for displaying arrangements, setting the date and time and other available options. I did not and most likely will not hook to the internet or iphone for viewing but in the initial hookup to test cameras etc, if you can hook up a DVD player to a tv you can easily figure this nice system out with no problem. I am very impressed with the night vision capability even in a very low light situation. System even came with a remote and a mouse which is handy. Over all I am extremely happy as it is my first system owned so was not sure what to expect except through other reviews which I found to be very useful in choosing this 8 camera set. Happy I did. Can not beat it for the price.. Thanks.

Reviews.Content: zmodo 8ch 500hd dvr..... alot of system for the price. support is a little lacking. no return email so far,, its been a week. the first time I called for setup a guy named Victor was extremely helpful.. NOTE: this system will not work with a Mac computer.... it is windows based only;... which was no problem for me, as I did not buy it for that reason, but if you want to network your system, it must be windows based or for iphone only,,,, blackberry... etc,,,,, not apple computer. The system is great! however, if you are going to use your night vision, you will not see anything unless you have a light to illuminate it with. I still love the system.... For my small condo it is perfect! I captured everything with 5 cameras, which will leave three more for capturing indoors.. I have not bought the extra ptz which allows you to tilt and rotate your views.... soon to come..... overall,, I like the system,,, I docked one point, because after all the research I did, I was little short of the understanding that it is not apple compatable,, i.e.... it is iphone compatable,,, they dont really come out and tell you that, and the other reviews did not specify. anyway. like I said it was not the reason for the purchase.  also docked with it,, for support,,, I will have to resend my email it looks like.... oh, also, forget about calling,, they will make you leave a message and also live chat is really good as far as getting someone, but they too refer alot to calling support when the issues get really involved,,, enjoy!\\
